intro: Caraipa multinervia, commonly known as the Caraipa tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is often found in humid, lowland forests and thrives in areas with high rainfall. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
